Note: Date based on the date of the Second Liberty Loan. Orientation: Vertical.
Description: Design for a newspaper and magazine advertisement for the Second Liberty Loan campaign.  The text says that three billion dollars are required to back up the troops. If people do not buy bonds to help out, German "Kultur" will rule the U.S.--the illustration shows the U.S. with "Germania" printed across it in Fraktur.
Digital Collection: Allied Posters of World War I
Local Rights Statement: This material is made available for private study, scholarship, and research use. For access to the original or a high resolution reproduction, contact: Temple University Libraries, Special Collections Research Center, scrc@temple.edu, 215-204-8257.
